channel.title: Where does it connect?
channel.description:
Ok, I ran the renamed class files with a batch file like this: [code]@echo off java -cp rs5196.jar; client 45 live live lowmem free pause [/code]
...and of course it can't connect because I have to change the IP; so I dig around in client.java and I [b]can't find the place it connects![/b] No getCodeBase! Nothing! >>
Don't tell me we have to completely remake the deob each time when we finally make a bot >>
EDIT: Usage: worldid, [live/office/local], [live/rc/wip], [lowmem/highmem], [free/members] I did: 45 live live lowmem free
And WTF did they do to their client! The messeges (ie. This account has been blocked, etc) are not in the client! The stats (remember the class with the yodelling and hexediting) is not there anymore.... Don't tell me the client is basically useless now :'(

item.title: Where does it connect?
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

[quote=“Asm, post:26, topic:3039”]It is bad idea to try to run renamed deob
Search for usages of java.lang.reflect.Method
New engine can send actual class/method name and its attributes to server…
And invoke any method/read any variable by server command[/quote]

@PSB: See, I told you they would probably notice it on their own…so I guess your way has its merits

Read full topic

item.title: Where does it connect?
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:14, topic:3039”]if i had a working deob id be able to mess with it and sort it out

im sure you have to use http://ul2.runescape.com/loader.jar and http://ul2.runescape.com/unpack.jar

Dont Quote me on this tho as i havent tested[/quote]

You shouldn’t need a deob to connect (at least, you didn’t need one before). Remember, the client is designed to work from a browser, not with someone who has source access.

runescape.jar
loader.jar
FrameAppApplet.java


^using the above components, no deob necessary, give it about 10 minutes

Read full topic

item.title: Where does it connect?
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

[quote=“Rictoo, post:10, topic:3039”][quote author=Krichevskoy link=topic=3458.msg34027#msg34027 date=1148063218]
Actually, what if Jagex’s new toy is might reduce all classes to their component methods and fields then shuffled them around randomly and fixed the references (preserving hierarchy of course)?
[/quote]

Exactly what I was thinking :’([br][size=1]Posted at: May 19, 2006, 11:43:54 am[/size][hr]Okay, I am not a CMem and I have no idea what’s going on on their Forums

Obviously you guys know where it connects. Please PM me with the information >>[/quote]

Obviously we know where it connects? News to me.

The login code is basically the same method as before, it’s just been cut up into several parts controlled by a state variable I’ve named loginDoWhat.
It’s structured like

   doWhat = 0;
   if(doWhat == 0) {
        initSomething();
        startSocket();
        etc();
        doWhat = 1;
   }

    if(doWhat == 1) {
        doSomethingElse();
        startISAAC();
        doWhat = 2;
    }

To find most of it, look for familiar login code like initializing the packet encryption (an int array filled with two Math.random() calls and some numbers derived from the session key) or calling the method that encrypts the RSA block (uses BigIntegers).

int ai[] = new int[4]; ai[0] = (int)(99999999D * Math.random()); ai[1] = (int)(99999999D * Math.random()); ai[2] = (int)(SomeClass.serverSessionID >> somenumber); ai[3] = (int)SomeClass.serverSessionID;

Read full topic

Exactly what I was thinking :’([br][size=1]Posted at: May 19, 2006, 11:43:54 am[/size][hr]Okay, I am not a CMem and I have no idea what’s going on on their Forums

Obviously you guys know where it connects. Please PM me with the information >>

Read full topic

item.title: Where does it connect?
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

All strings have been moved to instances of StringWrapper and shuffled randomly at the package level. Methods that were previously one method (like login) appear to have been sliced and shuffled around as well. There are instances of (I think) completely unrelated code being crammed together in the same class, which makes me wonder if perhaps we can’t count on having nice little organized classes like “NPC” and “Object” etc. Actually, what if Jagex’s new toy is might reduce all classes to their component methods and fields then shuffled them around randomly and fixed the references (preserving hierarchy of course)? That would suck.

Read full topic
